title.native: 究極進化したフルダイブRPGが現実よりもクソゲーだったら
title.romaji: Kyuukyoku Shinka Shita Full Dive RPG ga Genjitsu yori mo Kusogee Dattara
title.english: Full Dive: This Ultimate Next-Gen Full Dive RPG Is Even Shittier than Real Life!

description:
Yuuki Hiroshi has just picked up Kiwame Quest, the realest VRMMO ever made. But this RPG is TOO lifelike; he can smell, taste, feel, and when he's hurt in it, his physical body is hurt too. Even worse, his abilities in this adventure suck as much as they do in daily life. This was supposed to be immersion, not reality. Consumed with winning, he swears he'll conquer this game—even if it kills him!

(Source: Funimation)

Note: The first episode received an online advance screening on March 31, 2021. Regular TV broadcast started on April 7, 2021
synonyms: What If the Ultimate in Fully Immersive VR RPGs Was a Crappier Game Than Reality Itself
如果究极进化的完全潜行 RPG 比现实还更像垃圾游戏的话
Full Dive : L'ultime RPG est encore plus foireux que la réalité !
เมื่อ Full Dive RPG ได้กลายเป็นสิ่งที่แย่กว่าชีวิตจริง

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Parody
tags.description: Features deliberate exaggeration of popular tropes or a particular genre to comedic effect.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Female Harem
tags.description: Main cast features the protagonist plus several female characters who are romantically interested in them.

tags.name: Goblin
tags.description: A goblin is a monstrous creature from European folklore. They are almost always small and grotesque, mischievous or outright malicious, and greedy. Sometimes with magical abilities.

tags.name: Rehabilitation
tags.description: Prominently features the recovery of a character who became incapable of social life or work.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Prison
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a prison.

node.description: **Miura Kazuya** is a Japanese director, episode director, animator, animation supervisor, animation director and storyboard artist.

__Height:__ 151 cm

[Profile (Link Plan)](http://link-plan.net/talent_taketatsu.html) | [Website](http://ayanataketatsu.jp) | [Website (Pony Canyon)](https://ayanataketatsu.jp/) | [Website (Fanclub)](https://ayanakoukoku.com/) | [Blog](https://lineblog.me/ayana_taketatsu/) | [(Old) Blog](https://ameblo.jp/strawberry-ayana/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/Ayana_take) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ayachi_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/taketatsuofficial) | [Anison](http://anison.info/data/person/27399.html) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ayana_Taketatsu) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/竹達彩奈)

Attended Nihon Narration Engi Kenkyuujo before becoming affiliated with her first management company. She works for Link Plan and was formerly affiliated with I'm Enterprise and Assemble Heart. Because of her strong voice, she often voiced tsundere characters.

She is a member of the duo [Petit Milady](https://anilist.co/staff/116523/petit-milady) with fellow voice actress [Aoi Yuuki](https://anilist.co/staff/101686/Aoi-Yuuki).

She married voice actor [Yuuki Kaji](https://anilist.co/staff/95672/) on her 30th birthday in 2019. On June 30, 2022 she announced that she was expecting her first child with Kaji.

**Non-Anime Roles:**

- Anderson - Call of Duty: Black Ops II (VG) 
- Atama - Nisekoi: Yomeiri!? (VG)
- Belle - Pokémon Black/White 2 Trailer (Web Trailer)
- Chii Aruel - Soul Worker (VG)

**[Website](https://mayumaeshima.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/_0414mayu) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/_0414mayu/)**

Japanese singer. She was the lead vocalist of the music unit [MYTH & ROID](https://anilist.co/staff/119976) from 2015 to 2017. She made her major debut as a solo artist in 2019. Her first solo single "Long shot" was released on February 24, 2021 under KADOKAWA, and was used as the second opening theme to the second season of the anime series [Re:Zero − Starting Life in Another World](https://anilist.co/anime/119661).

__Height:__ 159 cm

__[Profile (Raccoon Dog)](https://www.raccoon-dog.co.jp/talent/r12-fai.html) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/fairouzzzzzz) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/fairouz_ai/) |  [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ai_Fairouz) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/ファイルーズあい)__

Japanese voice actress affiliated with Mausu Promotion (formerly Raccoon Dog).

Fairouz was born to a Japanese mother and an Egyptian father. She was named after the Lebanese singer, Fairuz. She spent a few years of her elementary education in Cairo before returning to Japan. During her junior high school years, she became familiar with the manga series [JoJo's Bizarre Adventure](https://anilist.co/manga/31517/). Due to her growing interest in the series, she would join Skype reading sessions with other fans. Eventually, she was inspired to pursue a career in voice acting, but her parents initially disapproved of her plans. Instead, she would initially study at a graphic design vocational school before spending a year as a dental assistant. Once she was able to save enough money for tuition, she enrolled in a voice acting training school.

In 2019, she debuted as [Hibiki Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/132856/), the protagonist of the anime series [How Heavy Are the Dumbbells You Lift?](https://anilist.co/anime/107226/)

In a Twitter post on 31st December 2024 she announced her indefinite hiatus from voice acting due to health complications surrounding PTSD. On April 1st, she announced she would be returning from hiatus, and that she would be leaving Raccoon Dog for talent agency Mausu Promotion.

__Awards:__
- Best New Actress at the 14th Seiyuu Awards in 2020 for her role as [Hibiki Sakura](https://anilist.co/character/132856/Hibiki-Sakura).

__Non-anime roles:__
- Belorta - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Soldier FA - Goddess of Victory: Nikke (VG)
- Ayre - Armored Core VI: Fires of Rubicon (VG)
- Iono - Pokémon Masters EX (VG)
- Eternity - Reverse 1999 (VG)
- Xilonen - Genshin Impact (VG)
- Catherina Grann - Metaphor: ReFantazio (VG)
- Aikiyo Fuuka - Blue Archive (VG)

__Height:__ 155 cm 

[Profile (EARLY WING)](http://earlywing.co.jp/talent_w/izawashiori.html) | [Blog](http://piyorivoice.blog64.fc2.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/shiori_izawa) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/shiori_izawa0201/)

__Non-Anime Roles:__
- Marco in "Marco & The Galaxy Dragon" (VG) (Japanese)
- Diona in "Genshin Impact" (VG)
- Moe Kazekura in "Blue Archive" (VG)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/824_aoi) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/koga_aoi0824/) | [Agency Profile](https://www.81produce.co.jp/actor_search/index.php/item?id=199) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/古賀葵)

Aoi Koga is a Japanese voice actress affiliated with 81 Produce.

Koga had an interest in anime since her childhood, watching series such as Cardcaptor Sakura and Ojamajo Doremi. She first became interested in voice acting after watching the television program Okaasan to Issho and becoming fond of the puppet segments featured in the show. This made her want to "become friends with dolls" and, along with her interest in anime, helped her decide to pursue a career in entertainment. In pursuit of becoming a voice actress, Koga would take acting lessons at a vocational school in Fukuoka. Following this, she enrolled in the training school of the agency 81 Produce, becoming affiliated with them upon her finishing her training.

__Awards:__
• Best Lead Actress at the 14th Seiyuu Awards in 2020 for her role as [Kaguya Shinomiya](https://anilist.co/character/120649/).

Non-Anime Roles:
~!
• [Paimon](https://anilist.co/character/203317/Paimon) - Genshin Impact (VG)
• [Kriemhild](https://anilist.co/character/343255/Kriemhild) - Fate/Grand Order (VG)
• [Rozaliya Olenyeva](https://anilist.co/character/207926/Rozaliya-Olenyeva) - Honkai Impact 3rd (VG)
• Ivy - Memento Mori (VG)
• [Kunimi Tama](https://anilist.co/character/321902/Tama-Kunimi) - Heaven Burns Red (VG)!~

Kazuo Takigawa is an animator, character designer and storyboard artist.
